alert.note: Alert for Bristol (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:38PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Massachusetts, including the following counties, Bristol, Norfolk, Plymouth and Worcester and Rhode Island, including the following counties, Bristol, Kent, Newport, Providence and Washington. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Urban and poor drainage flooding is imminent or occurring. Expect rises on small streams and creeks, potentially to over bankfull. There may be instances of water intruding into residential basements. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water on roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1038 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, New Bedford, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Taunton, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Dartmouth, Cumberland, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, Bridgewater, North Kingstown, Newport and Bristol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
